intro: Albertisia apiculata, commonly known as the slender Albertisia, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a fine, powdery coating. Albertisia apiculata is typically found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
